image.altText: A girl in her 20s with green eyes looks straight at the camera wearings timber Aboriginal designed earrings

props.synopsis: With more than 600 Indigenous deaths in custody since the royal commission, First Nations families say the staggering toll is Australia's shame.

title.children: Six hundred deaths, little justice: The ongoing toll of deaths in custody

image.altText: Looking up at the pillars outside the Victorian Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will move to make it even harder for repeat offenders to get bail when parliament resumes today, while the opposition and Greens will scrutinise scandals in the childcare sector.

title.children: Education department to be probed in Greens' parliamentary inquiry into childcare

image.altText: Two women, one in indigenous head dress and cloak, smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in Victoria's north-west are the first in the state to be granted exclusive native title rights. But what does that mean and how will it work?

title.children: The strongest form of native title is now in Victoria. Here’s how it works

image.altText: A sign saying "Wyndham City Civic Centre", with bicycles in front of it.

props.synopsis: A council in Melbourne's booming outer south-west has been referred to the state's anti-corruption watchdog over a failed IT project worth tens of millions of dollars.

title.children: Wyndham council referred to anti-corruption watchdog over IT bungle

image.altText: Rainbow over cropping farm at Walpeup, Victoria.

props.synopsis: Welcome rain has brought smiles to farmers' faces and boosted water storages in Victoria.

title.children: Victorian farmer says calves 'aren't used to' influx of rain

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria does not need a permit system for protests, says the state's new top cop, who concedes there has been a breakdown in public confidence in police.

title.children: Weeks into the job, Victoria's new police chief admits there is 'too much crime'

image.altText: The Coroners Court of Victoria exterior in daylight.

props.synopsis: The mother of a baby boy who died after a planned home birth tells an inquest she assumed she would be transferred to hospital when complications first arose, but a midwife chose to monitor her "more closely".

title.children: Mother recalls 'what if' moment during home birth at baby death inquest

image.altText: A dark grey cockatoo on a tree branch covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Gang-gang cockatoos like cool weather, but freezing conditions are putting them at risk this winter, as volunteers race to save grounded birds in the Victorian Alps.

title.children: Race to save endangered gang-gang cockatoos grounded with frozen wings

image.altText: Police tape

props.synopsis: A man in his 40s was flown to The Alfred hospital with a gunshot wound to his upper body.

title.children: 37yo arrested after shooting in western Victoria

image.altText: An excavator sits atop a pile of woodchips.

props.synopsis: A former golf course in inner-Melbourne is being transformed into what the council describes as a biodiversity refuge of wetlands and wildflower meadows, but residents fear the removal of native trees is undermining the project's aims.

title.children: 'Ham-fisted' tree removal sparks concerns as golf course transformed

image.altText: A woman in a red-and-white football uniform jumps onto the shoulders of a woman in a black-and-white uniform.

props.synopsis: AFLW burst onto the scene nine years ago with a lockout crowd but since then, crowds have dwindled. Here's how the league plans to get them back up.

title.children: AFLW has a crowd problem. Here's how the league wants to fix it

image.altText: Damage along the front left of an aircraft named Virgin Australia

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane becomes disconnected from a tug vehicle and collides into it at Tullamarine airport.

title.children: Virgin plane collides with tug vehicle at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: A paramedic treating a patient in the back of an ambulance.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria releases a toolkit to teach paramedics how to make adjustments at work to help staff and patients who are neurodiverse.

title.children: Ambulances can cause sensory overload, but a new toolkit could help

image.altText: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaps in the air in celebration

props.synopsis: St Kilda's Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera kicks a game-winning goal after the siren as the Saints overturn a 46-point three-quarter time deficit to stun Melbourne at Docklands Stadium.

title.children: Wanganeen-Milera's heroics help Saints complete greatest final quarter comeback in VFL/AFL history

image.altText: Two houses with smoking chimneys and city in background.

props.synopsis: Wood heaters are estimated to be responsible for more pollution-related deaths than all the cars on our roads. This national map shows which areas are affected the most.

title.children: Map reveals where 'silent killer' wood heater smoke is worst

image.altText: On an overcast day, you view a large post-war modernist public housing tower with others seen on the horizon.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's housing agency is hiring an internal homebuyer as it works to find new homes for thousands of residents displaced by its controversial plan to redevelop Melbourne's public housing towers.

title.children: Victoria hiring homebuyer to relocate public housing tower residents

image.altText: A man reaches up to touch medicine on the top shelf at a pharmacy.

props.synopsis: Pharmacists in healthcare black spots in regional Victoria are increasingly stepping up as frontline healthcare providers, but not everyone is on board.

title.children: Rural pharmacists take on expanded role in Victoria to bridge GP gap

image.altText: a man in a white shirt and blue apron holds tongs and smiles while two teenagers watch on

props.synopsis: Tradies including chefs make a career change to teaching as Victorian schools get creative to fill staff shortages.

title.children: Tradies swap tools for textbooks as they make career change to teaching

image.altText: A man being escorted by an officer in black into a silver car

props.synopsis: Court documents show a trainee surgeon accused of secretly snapping intimate images of unsuspecting colleagues in hospital toilets allegedly ranked the photos and videos.

title.children: Melbourne doctor accused of filming colleagues in hospital toilets allegedly 'ranked' intimate content

image.altText: A bright yellow oval shaped ball being held in the air

props.synopsis: The AFL says it wants to "protect" the White Hills Junior Football Club following revelations it allowed a convicted sex offender parent to time-keep at his son's match.

title.children: Club allowed convicted sex offender to time-keep at junior football match

image.altText: A woman with a child sitting in her lap sits in front of a sign reading: 18 months our 3 year is waiting for his surgery.

props.synopsis: A Bendigo mother has successfully protested and her son has received surgery after an 18-month wait for a public hospital ENT appointment amid a regional specialist shortage.

title.children: Mother stages sit-in at major children's hospital to get appointment for son

image.altText: An entrance sign for ForestOne's Benalla manufacturing facility

props.synopsis: A north-east Victorian community raises concerns about the partial closure of ForestOne's manufacturing site in Benalla.

title.children: Major employer in Benalla scaling back operations as costs increase

image.altText: Image of a bank branch in a country town.

props.synopsis: Bendigo Bank announced this week it will close 28 agency services across the country, leaving residents in the small town of Cunderdin facing a 120-kilometre round trip to access some banking services.

title.children: Regional towns look for solutions as Bendigo Bank closes agencies

image.altText: Police officers stand next to a police car parked next to the driveway of a house

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of an elderly couple at a home in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Police investigate death of elderly couple at Melbourne home

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in reports related to Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: A top-down view of a classic black Citroen on a driveway.

props.synopsis: Nearly a decade after the final Australian-made car rolled out of a factory in South Australia, many people remember that Holdens and Fords were built here. But did you know Renaults, Ramblers and other foreign cars were also put together by Australian workers?

title.children: Back when even foreign luxury cars were Australian-made

image.altText: The entry to Mount Scopus Memorial College, a rendered white fence with an Australian and Jewish flag

props.synopsis: One of Melbourne's biggest Jewish schools, Mount Scopus Memorial College, says a group of grade five students were subjected to antisemitic slurs during an excursion to Melbourne Museum on Thursday.

title.children: Jewish school students allegedly targeted with antisemitic verbal abuse

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into an ampoule.

props.synopsis: A Victorian doctor who wrote up nearly 200 false exemptions in one week during the height of the pandemic has had his appeal against his suspension dismissed.

title.children: Doctor who handed out vaccine, mask exemptions has appeal dismissed

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiles while sitting with a cocktail on a patio.

props.synopsis: The 23-year-old, who is in a remand centre, appeared in a Victorian court for a directions hearing ahead of his sentencing for killing his ex-partner.

title.children: Hannah McGuire's murderer, Lachlan Young, appears in court

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Those who paid off their student loans quickly before indexation rose may regret that decision, now that HECS-HELP debts are set to be slashed by 20 per cent.

title.children: Student debt regret: What it means for those who have paid off HECS

image.altText: Brian Dixon wearing a tuxedo sitting in a chair with an award in his hand

props.synopsis: Five-time premiership footballer and politician Brian Dixon, who was a key figure behind the 'Life be in it' campaign and mandatory seatbelt legislation, has been farewelled at a state funeral in Melbourne.

title.children: 'Extraordinary' life of AFL hall-of-famer, former MP celebrated

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man involved in an armed gang fight that sent Melbourne's Northland Shopping Centre into lockdown in May will be released from custody to complete community work.

title.children: Teen involved in Melbourne shopping centre gang fight released from custody

image.altText: A mine pit filled with water, against a green backdrop.

props.synopsis: Environmental groups want the owners of Victoria's three brown-coal mines to pay for the water needed to turn their vast sites into lakes.

title.children: Closed coal mines to be turned into lakes, but who pays for the water?

image.altText: A photo taken from a plane window shows a thin river with lots of twists and turns, and native vegetation on the bank.

props.synopsis: Thirteen years since the start of the Murray-Darling Basin Plan, a comprehensive evaluation finds rivers, wetlands and lakes are in far better shape.

title.children: Positive report card for Murray-Darling Basin Plan, but not all agree

image.altText: Accused graffiti artist Jack Gibson-Burrell enters court wearing a Spiderman mask, flanked by his lawyer

props.synopsis: The alleged creator of the Pam the Bird graffiti tag is facing dozens of additional charges, and has grabbed attention by exiting court sporting a Spider-Man costume.

title.children: Alleged 'Pam the Bird' creator dons Spider-Man costume,  faces 208 charges
